intro: Manglietia fordiana var. forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or the white-flowered manglietia, is a rare and ornamental evergreen shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes ancient flowering plants with primitive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves and showy, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. It is typically found in humid, shaded forest environments at higher elevations. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and is considered a conservation priority.
